intro: Monarda humilis, commonly known as wild bergamot, is a herbaceous perennial native to North America. It belongs to the mint family (Lamiaceae) and is characterized by its aromatic, fuzzy leaves and showy pink or purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in moist, open woods and prairies, and it plays a role in supporting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its leaves are used in herbal teas and have historical medicinal uses among indigenous peoples.
